body_html:
How am i supposed to use this with the Tensorflow Object Detection API?
There i have a "Fine-Tune Checkpoint" which is an option in the configuration file that points to a single file. I use the Inception v2 Checkpoint from here - again, a single file.
Previously (r1.5) the training worked just fine with that. However, using TF from the current master or r1.6 (which includes this change here, other than r1.5) it only produces the ValueError you raise in saver.py at line 1749.
Is the API simply missing support for this and i should post it there or am i doing it wrong?
body_text:
How am i supposed to use this with the Tensorflow Object Detection API?
There i have a "Fine-Tune Checkpoint" which is an option in the configuration file that points to a single file. I use the Inception v2 Checkpoint from here - again, a single file.
Previously (r1.5) the training worked just fine with that. However, using TF from the current master or r1.6 (which includes this change here, other than r1.5) it only produces the ValueError you raise in saver.py at line 1749.
Is the API simply missing support for this and i should post it there or am i doing it wrong?
body:
How am i supposed to use this with the Tensorflow Object Detection API? 
There i have a "Fine-Tune Checkpoint" which is an option in the configuration file that points to a single file. I use the Inception v2 Checkpoint from [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/models/tree/master/research/slim) - again, a single file. 
Previously (r1.5) the training worked just fine with that. However, using TF from the current master or r1.6 (which includes this change here, other than r1.5) it only produces the ValueError you raise in saver.py at line 1749. 
Is the API simply missing support for this and i should post it there or am i doing it wrong?
